review: I bought two of these. One worked great, it had the cable hook up to plug into an outlet and power the Roku. The second one . . had no power cable. Evidently, there are two versions of this item, some need an MHL port, some just a USB port . . unfortunately, I plugged in the useable version to my TV and then plugged in the NON USEABLE version (MHL) to the second TV about a month later . . and the seller wouldn't take a return. So I lost about 40 dollars on the second one, since it wont' work at all unless you have an MHL port, something I'd never heard of before. I will probably try to resell it, the seller wouldn't take it back. The useable Roku is great though.

author: Samantha Giampietro

review: Previous to this we were using our Playstation 3 to connect to Netflix and HBO Go in our bedroom.  It was such a pain due to connection issues and the unit heating up and freezing with a couple of hours of use.  I wish we had gotten a Roku a long time ago because it has made watching Netflix and HBO so much easier.  I wasn't sure which model to get, but I'm glad I got the one with the remote.  Now we are debating whether to even get a cable/DVR box for the bedroom, because this plus the standard plug in cable is meeting our current TV watching needs.
